title: Has the proportion of social care users who found it easy to access information changed?
analysis_commentary:
The Care and Support White Paper highlighted how important it is for people to access the right information and advice to improve care and support. Here we look at what proportion of people who use social care services found it easy to find information about services. Because of changes to methodology in 2014-15, data from that year onwards cannot be directly compared to previous years.

In 2014-5, 74.5% of service users found it easy to access information about support while it was only 65.5% of carers. Similarly in 2015-16, 73.5% of respondents found it fairly or very easy to find information about services. The carers survey is only undertaken every second year, so there is no data on this for 2015/16.

Updated October 2016.
data_source: NHS Digital, Adult Social Care Outcomes Framework
